com.LockerRoom.Server

Class LockerRoomServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.LockerRoom.Server.LockerRoomServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class LockerRoomServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class consists of the LockerRoom code that actively listens for new LockerRoomClients, monitors existing connected clients, and distributes new messages to these clients.
    Author:
    Tommy Ho

      void publishMessage(java.lang.String message)
      When called upon by individual ClientManager threads, the publishMessage() method accesses the ArrayList of PrintWriter objects and flushes the message via socket output stream over to the LockerRoomClient objects to process.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The run() method here overrides the method inherited from the Runnable interface. It retrieves the lone instance of the LockerRoomServer and calls its go() method to get things rolling.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Parameters:
        -
        See Also:
        go(), getInstance()

      • getInstance

        public static LockerRoomServer getInstance()
        The getInstance() method returns the static LockerRoomServer instance. If it is null, it will instantiate it.
        Parameters:
        -
        Returns:
        the LockerRoomServer static instance
        See Also:
        go()

      • go

        private void go()
        The go() method is the core of this class. It opens up a new ServerSocket and listens for all incoming traffic from LockerRoomClient code. It accepts new clients and assigns a PrintWriter object to the client socket for sending future messages. Lastly, it creates a new thread with the ClientManager class to listen for messages from the client.
        Parameters:
        -

      • publishMessage

        public void publishMessage(java.lang.String message)
        When called upon by individual ClientManager threads, the publishMessage() method accesses the ArrayList of PrintWriter objects and flushes the message via socket output stream over to the LockerRoomClient objects to process.
        Parameters:
        -
